poem:
Title: The Garden of Power

In the garden of power,
an 'evil plotter' blossoms.
WhatsApp is her bower,
pruning ideas, while autumns.

Cast stones at Sunak's keep,
minister where she soars,
yet, criticism she does reap,
from the heartbeat of the Tory's core.

Cabinet's favourite bloom,
yet whispers stir of succession,
in the political gloom,
an ironic foreshadowing's session.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kemi Badenoch is member of ‘Evil Plotters’ Tory WhatsApp group Kemi Badenoch is a member of a Conservative WhatsApp group called “Evil Plotters” despite telling party rebels to “stop messing around” and get behind Rishi Sunak, the Guardian can reveal. The business secretary, who consistently comes out as the favourite cabinet minister in polls of Tory members, has criticised party colleagues for “stirring” up suggestions that she could replace the prime minister. In a round". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
